title: Wins and Experience Matching
body:
Hello LoL Peeps,

I've been playing since about the end of Season 3, though not regularly so have only accumulated ~500 Wins.

However, it annoys me when I get into a game and there are people on my team who only have 60 - 100 wins due to the new faster leveling.

So, what do you all think about;
Being matched with people who are around the same amount of wins?
AND/OR,
Tripling the amount of experience (and wins) needed to get to level 30?
AND/OR,
Have the leveling system go past level 30 (maybe to 80/100) and get matched with people around your level?
Maybe like the new 6 and 7 mastery system, you can only gain experience past level 30 if you get a A- or more in your games.

Tell me what you think, or your experiences with the new leveling system, whether from a newbie or veteran point of view. 

-Cyan Shinobi

replies.body:
I don't really know and or care that much.
However it does annoy me slightly, but for different reasons.

Way back when reaching lvl 30 took some effort.
by the time you hit lvl 30 and if you only spent IP on champions and teir 3 runes.
You could have a decnt basic set up for ranked.

However new players or those that decide to not think.
Wont buy or have a full teir 3 rune page.

My only issue is what is it going to do to ranked, as newer players who just jump in and have no idea what's going on has caused issues before.

I totally agree. Leveling up that fast doesn't give them time to adjust to new Runes or Masteries or Champions for that matter.

In Ranked maybe it could be, only if you have all T3 runes, all mastery points used, and the champ you chose has to have a T3 mastery....

Definitely with ranked there needs to be an experience or wins counter matching involved.

I've said it before on the really old league forums, and on these ones, and on a support ticket to riot.
lvl 30 and 16 champs is fine for going into ranked, but I suggested they needed at least 1 teir 3 completed rune page, and over X amount of normal wins.
I believe my initial suggestion for wins was 300-400.

Then everything will be great.

It's pretty simple these days to see what Riot are doing, and that is nothing but allow newer players to get to ranked faster and feel like they have not missed anything or taken too long to get there.

Whilst we don't want new players to take too long to get anywhere, otherwise they may end up leaving before being able to play ranked, we don't want new players to ruin the game, too bad Riot don't care.
